quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Album and Group
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, pink, drugs. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This band would be among the first to pioneer the use of the moog synthesizer on their album Pisces, Aquarius, Capricorn  Jones Ltd (1967). Not even the Beatles had experimented with this revolutionary instrument yet. In fact, the vocalist on the highly psychedelic track Daily Nightly (sound clip) owned one of the first twenty synthesizers ever sold.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Monkees

questions.question: This group is considered the grandaddy of all progressive rock bands. Their psychedelic anthem (sound clip) from their debut album certainly displays both psychedelic and prog rock tendencies, and was featured in the 2006 Oscar nominated film Children of Men.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: King Crimson

questions.question: What instrument is Weird Al” Yankovic famous for playing on his albums and videos?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Accordion

questions.question: What childrens voices are heard in KISS song God of Thunder?

options.text: They were the sons of Gene Simmons
No one knows, they were from the studio stock
They were the sons of producer Bob Ezrin
Harvey Stephens, a.k.a Damien Thorn in the original movie The Omen

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They were the sons of producer Bob Ezrin

questions.question: What did Weird Al” say was his reason for choosing architecture as a major in college?

options.text: He would have something to fall back on if his music career didnt pan out.
He liked playing with Lincoln Logs as a child.
It was the first major listed in CalPolys catalog.
He couldnt picture himself as a doctor or a lawyer.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It was the first major listed in CalPolys catalog.

questions.question: Which one of of these statements about Weird Al Yankovic is true?

options.text: Weird Al became a vegetarian in 1992.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Weird Al became a vegetarian in 1992.

questions.question: This group known for utilizing orchestra arrangements and odd instruments like the mellowtron released the psychedelic classics Ride My See-Saw and Tuesday Afternoon in 1968. The 30-second sound clip is their tribute to 60s counterculture icon and LSD promoter Timothy Leary called Legend of a Mind.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Moody Blues

questions.question: Paul Stanley usually played lead guitar in KISS.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In 1967 Pink Floyd released this psychedelic album featuring references to scarecrows, space, satanic cats, bicycles and hobbits. The sound clip is from the albums surrealistic fairy tale Matilda Mother.

options.text: Piper at the Gates of Dawn

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Piper at the Gates of Dawn

questions.question: In an attempt to outdo the Beatles Sgt. Pepper album this group released the particularly unsuccessful LP Their Satanic Majesties Request in 1967.  The 3-D album cover features hidden images of the Fab Four and contains trippy psychedelic songs like 2000 Light Years from Home (sound clip).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Rolling Stones

questions.question: How did Weird Al Yankovic get his start in the music business?

options.text: He won a talent search at his local high school.
His father was in the recording business.
He sent his homemade tapes into Dr. Dementos nationally syndicated radio show.
He performed on a public access talent show in his home town.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He sent his homemade tapes into Dr. Dementos nationally syndicated radio show.

questions.question: What is Weird Als real name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alfred Matthew Yankovic

questions.question: In what year did Weird Al release his first album?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1983

questions.question: Psychedelic music was inspired by the mind-altering experiences brought on by certain drugs. The effect was certainly achieved by the Beatles in masterpieces such as Tomorrow Never Knows, Strawberry Fields Forever and Within You Without You. What Beatles album is the haunting George Harrison mind trip Blue Jay Way from?

options.text: Sgt. Peppers Lonely Hearts Club Band

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Magical Mystery Tour

questions.question: Weird Al” Yankovics first hit recording My Bologna was a direct parody of what song?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: My Sharona

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Group
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, title, dont. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What singer is responsible for giving us the 1990 hit song Black Velvet?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alannah Myles

questions.question: The song Unskinny Bop was a huge song in 1990 for this band.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Poison

questions.question: Which group had a hit top ten song in 1990 with Epic?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Faith No More

questions.question: I Wanna Be Rich was a huge hit song for this group in 1990.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Calloway

questions.question: In 1990, these two veteran singers had a smash hit song called All My Life.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Linda Ronstadt  Aaron Neville

questions.question: What is the middle name of RB singer Chris Brown?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Maurice

questions.question: Does RB singer Chris Brown have tattoos?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: Who had a smash hit song in 1990 called Close to You?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Maxi Priest

questions.question: What singer is responsible for supplying us with Here and Now, one of the biggest wedding songs of the 1990s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Luther Vandross

questions.question: What all female group had a hit song in 1990 with Hold On?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: En Vogue

questions.question: Certainly not as popular as it was in the late 60s, psychedelic music continues nonetheless. This group has released several successful psychedelic albums in the 21st century including: Yoshimi Battles the Pink Robots (2002) and At War with the Mystics (2006). The song The W.A.N.D (sound clip) is from their 2006 Grammy Award-winning album.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Flaming Lips

questions.question: Who sang the song Love Will Lead You Back, which was very popular in 1990?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Taylor Dayne

questions.question: What is the title of Chris Browns first single?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Run It

questions.question: The Small Faces were, second only to The Who, the worlds most successful mod band. The group would become increasingly psychedelic in sound, as demonstrated by this song which reached Billboard #16 (sound clip). It contains the lyrics: I feel inclined to blow my mind/ Get hung up feed the ducks with a bun
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Itchycoo Park

questions.question: Who is responsible for giving us the song I Dont Have the Heart, which was popular in late 1990?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Ingram

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Johann Sebastian Bach and Chris Brown
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, bet, jam. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: When was German composer, Johann Sebastian Bach born, and on what date did he pass away?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: March 21, 1685 -- July 28, 1750

questions.question: Which statement best describes J.S.Bachs family life?

options.text: He had 2 wives and 20 children who survived infancy
He had 2 wives and 10 children who survived infancy
He had 3 wives and 20 children who survived infancy
He had 1 wife and 20 children who survived infancy

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He had 2 wives and 10 children who survived infancy

questions.question: In 2005 Chris Brown was signed to Def Jam.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Johann Sebastian Bach went to the same school, School in Eisenach, as this famous man.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Martin Luther

questions.question: Which of these is not a work composed by Johann Sebastian Bach?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Atonal Harpsichord

questions.question: Chris Browns debut album is titled The Future.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In Johann Sebastian Bachs day, what was meant by a concert ordinaire?

options.text: A concert featuring only the local musicians
A concerto for violin and organ

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The regularly scheduled concert

questions.question: Singer Chris Brown won 2 BET Awards in 2006.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of these is Chris Browns first manager?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tina Davis

questions.question: Besides playing violin, harpsichord, organ and clavichord, which of these was young J.S. Bach noted for?

options.text: He wrote the Brandenburg Concertos when he was 16
He wrote an opera before he was 13
He wrote a beautiful requiem when he was 13

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: His soprano voice

questions.question: RB singer Chris Brown was born in which US state?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Virginia

questions.question: In Johann Sebastian Bachs era, what was meant by clavier?

options.text: The harpsichord - a precursor of the piano
A clavichord - a precursor of the piano

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Any keyboard instrument

questions.question: On February 2006, RB singer Chris Brown appeared on the cover of which magazine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vibe

questions.question: Which of these statements bests describes the Bach family, when Johann Sebastian Bach was born?

options.text: Musically talented, but a very small family
Musically average with most of the family involved in theology
Musically talented with most family members living long lives
Musically talented, but the parents did not live very long

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Musically talented, but the parents did not live very long

questions.question: Which of these statements best describes the works of J.S. Bach?

options.text: A wide variety of forms, styles and keys
An atonal selections of keys with great counterpoint
An atonal selection of non-complex music
A wide variety of keys for only a few instruments

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A wide variety of forms, styles and keys

options.text: The Tonight Show starring Johnny Carson
